How to use Monvvo auto loan payoff calculator

  1. Enter your current loan balanceâ€”the remaining amount you owe on your auto loan.
  2. Input the remaining term in monthsâ€”the number of payments left on your loan.
  3. Provide your interest rate (APR%) to calculate total interest costs and repayment time.
  4. Enter your monthly payment amount to reflect your standard loan repayment schedule.
  5. Add an extra monthly payment to see how additional payments impact your payoff date and interest savings.
  6. Include a one-time lump sum payment if you plan to make a large extra payment to reduce your loan balance.
  7. Click Update to calculate your new payoff timeline, total interest savings, and updated loan schedule.
  8. Adjust inputs to explore different payoff strategies and find the best way to save on interest.

Auto Loan Payoff Terms

Current Loan Balance

The remaining amount owed on your auto loan. This is the total debt before any extra payments are applied.

Remaining Term

The number of months left on your loan until itâ€™s fully paid off.

Interest Rate

The annual percentage rate (APR) charged on your loan. A lower rate reduces interest costs over time.

Monthly Payment

The required amount you pay each month, covering both principal and interest.

Extra Monthly Payment

An optional additional amount paid each month to reduce your balance faster and save on interest.

One-Time Lump Sum Payment

A single large extra payment applied to the loan, which can shorten the repayment term and lower total interest paid.
